revised_title: Ultra-Violet Absorption Spectra of Complex Aromatic Hydrocarbons
tldr: The authors studied the ultra-violet absorption spectra of complex aromatic hydrocarbons, including benzene, chrysene, and other related compounds. They observed similarities in the absorption spectra of these molecules and found that at low temperatures, the spectra become more distinct with separate bands. This research contributes to the understanding of the properties and behavior of complex organic molecules.
